
```{r}
source("util.R")
library(scales)
pop <- 33792
lex <- fread("../src/lex/lexington-cases.csv")
lex <- tail(lex, -1)
lex <- zoo(lex$Cases, as.Date(lex$Date))
knitr::opts_chunk$set(fig.width=13, fig.height=3, warning=FALSE)
```

**As of `r format(end(lex), "%a %b %d")`:**

New cases per week:<br>
```{r}
autoplot.weekly.bar(weekly.deltas(lex))
```

Daily change in new cases (averaged over week):<br>
```{r}
ts <- ave.daily.change(lex)
ts[time(ts) <= "2020-03-28"] <- NA
autoplot(ts) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0, linetype="dashed", color="grey") +
  theme(panel.grid.minor = element_blank()) +
  scale_x_eow(lex) +
  scale_y_daily_change()
```

New cases per day:<br>
```{r}
autoplot(daily.deltas(lex), geom='blank') +
  scale_x_eow(lex) +
  geom_col()
```

Raw daily data: [lexington-cases.csv](../lex/lexington-cases.csv)

Source: [Lexington Town Website](https://www.lexingtonma.gov/public-health/pages/everything-you-need-know-during-covid-19-state-emergency)
